title: IOS Safari 15.4 released, try new CSS elements svh, lvh, dvh
body:
If the iPhone determines the height of content based on `vh`, there has been a problem so far with the URL bar not being able to sense when it is shown/hidden, resulting in unwanted scrolling.

To date, we have dealt with the situation in the following ways

```css
.container {
    height: -webkit-fill-available
}
```

One problem with this approach is that it cannot be used as an argument to `calc()`, and there have been very painful cases when the height is determined by a calculation process.

This has been resolved with the release of 15.4 and we will show you how to do it.

[Safari 15.4 Release Note](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safari- release- notes/safari- 15_4- release- notes)

Among these, svh, lvh, and dvh are described.

-  Small Viewport(svh)
-  Display size minus all height of URL bars, etc.
-  Large Viewport(lvh)
-  Display size minus all height of minimized URL bars, etc.
-  Dynamic Viewport(dvh)
-  Value that varies per URL bar size from display size

From left to right: svh, lvh, dvh

iPhone SE3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29157528/170875011-309c4694-12f7-4dc3-84e9-12f653572a06.png)

iPhone 13
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29157528/170875791-b426f6ad-8c75-4a52-a2d4-0f0818e7d3ea.png)

## End

This will save us from the IOS curse...

svh, lvh, and dvh are only supported on IOS 15.4 or later, and no others (including PC Chrome). Therefore, vh must also be listed for other browser support.
